page.title: 16Changing Times - 1925
page.content: . Pontlottyn had terraced houses with coal fires for heating,gas or paraffin lighting and a cold water supply. Because of the coal strikes of the twenties local business men went bankrupt.There was 30% unemployment at this time.The low pay of the collier was Â£2 and 6d a week.His boy assistant got 2/6 a week.People walked everywhere.There was a good railway system but it was too expensive.It brought in supplies to Pontlottyn, Rhymney and Fochriw.The horse drawn brake was the cheapest transport.There were three schools in Pontlottyn.The Infants',The Girls' School and the Boys' School.Slates and chalk were used.The local pits were Tynewydd, Dyffryn and Maerdy.Some women worked on top pit.
